(Ord. 910 § 2, 2003; Ord. 902 §§ 1-2, 2002; Ord. 829 §§ 1, 2, 1996; amended during 1988 codification: prior code § 2.1-2.0301 (part)) 
(Ord. No. 1002, § 3, 2-13-2014) 
Chapter 10.16 - TRAFFIC REGULATIONS GENERALLY 

10.16.010 - Parking lights-Display exempt when. 
    In accordance with authorization granted by Section 321.395, Code of Iowa, motor vehicles parked upon any street where permitted by this chapter need not display required lights where there is sufficient light emitted from city street lights to reveal any person or object within a distance of five hundred feet upon such street. 
(Amended during 1988 codification: prior code § 2.1-2.0301(14)) 
10.16.020 - Play streets designated. 
    The chief of police shall have authority to declare any street or part thereof a play street and to place appropriate signs or devices in the roadway indicating and helping to protect the same. Whenever authorized signs are erected indicating any street or part thereof as a play street, no person shall drive a vehicle upon any such street or portion thereof except drivers of vehicles having business or whose residences are within such closed area, and then any driver shall exercise the greatest care in driving upon any such street or portion thereof. 
(Amended during 1988 codification: prior code § 2.1-2.0302) 
10.16.030 - Vehicles on sidewalks. 
    The driver of a vehicle shall not drive upon or within any sidewalk area except at a driveway. 
(Amended during 1988 codification: prior code § 2.1-2.0303) 
10.16.040 - Clinging to vehicles. 
    No person shall drive a motor vehicle on the streets of the city unless all passengers of the vehicle are inside the vehicle in the place intended for their accommodation. No person shall ride on the runningboard of a motor vehicle or in any other place not customarily used for carrying passengers. No person riding upon any bicycle, coaster, roller skates, sled or toy vehicle shall attach the same or himself to any vehicle upon a roadway. 
(Amended during 1988 codification: prior code § 2.1-2.0304) 
10.16.050 - Quiet zones. 
    Whenever authorized signs are erected indicating a quiet zone, no person operating a motor vehicle within any such zone shall sound the horn or other warning device of such vehicle except in an emergency. 
(Amended during 1988 codification: prior code § 2.1-2.0306) 
10.16.060 - Funeral or other processions. 
A.  Identified. A funeral or other procession composed of vehicles shall be identified as such by the display upon the outside of each vehicle of a pennant or other identifying insignia or by such other method as may be determined and designated by the police chief. 
B.  Manner of Driving. Each driver in a funeral or other procession shall drive as near to the right-hand of the roadway as practical and shall follow the vehicle ahead as closely as is practical and safe. 
C.  Interrupting Procession. No driver of any vehicle shall drive between the vehicles comprising a funeral or other authorized procession while they are in motion and when such vehicles are conspicuously designated as required in this chapter. This provision shall not apply at intersections where traffic is controlled by traffic-control signals or peace officers. 
(Amended during 1988 codification: prior code § 2.1-2.0308) 
10.16.070 - Excessive acceleration. 
    It is unlawful for any person in the operation of a motor vehicle, including motorcycles, to so accelerate such vehicle as to cause audible noise by the friction of the tires on the pavement or to cause the tires of the vehicle to leave skid marks on the pavement, or to cause the front wheel of a motorcycle to leave the ground more than two inches, except when such acceleration is reasonably necessary to avoid a collision. 
(Amended during 1988 codification: prior code § 2.1-2.0309) 
10.16.080 - Trucks over seven feet in height prohibited from entering alley. 
    It is unlawful for any person in the operation of a truck over seven feet in height to enter from State Street the north-south alley located between Dodge Street and Thorington Street. 
(Ord. 741 § 1, 1989) 
10.16.090 - Motorized vehicles prohibited on Des Moines River Trail. 
    It is unlawful for any person to operate any type of motorized vehicle, including motorcycles and motorized bicycles, on the Des Moines River Trail. However, motorized vehicles specifically authorized by the city to work on the trail for purposes of construction, reconstruction, maintenance, removal or any other reason deemed appropriate by the city shall be allowed on the Des Moines River Trail. Bicycles propelled by human power only shall be allowed on the Des Moines River Trail. 
(Ord. 787 § 1, 1992) 
10.16.100 - Motorized vehicles prohibited off of roadways and parking areas within city parks. 
    It is unlawful for any person to operate any type of motorized vehicle, including but not limited to motorcycles, mopeds, motorized bicycles and all-terrain vehicles, off of the roadways or parking areas within any park located in the city. However, motorized vehicles specifically authorized by the city to work in any park shall be allowed. 
(Ord. 803 § 1, 1994) 
10.16.110 - Truck traffic prohibited-Streets designated. 
    It is unlawful for any person to operate a motor truck, semitrailer or any other motor vehicle with trailer attached designed primarily for carrying livestock, merchandise or freight of any kind on any of the following named streets. The provisions of this section shall not apply to pickup, light delivery or panel delivery trucks: 
1.  Oak Street, from Main Street to Putnam Street. 
(Ord. 894 § 1, 2002) 
Chapter 10.20 - TRAFFIC-CONTROL DEVICES 

10.20.010 - Standards adopted. 
    Traffic-control devices shall comply with standards established by the Manual of Uniform Traffic Control Devices for Streets and Highways. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0204) 
10.20.020 - Installation authorized-Records. 
    The police chief shall cause to be placed and maintained traffic-control devices when and as required under the traffic code of the city to make effective its provisions; emergency or temporary traffic-control devices for the duration of an emergency or temporary condition as traffic conditions may require to regulate traffic under the traffic code of the city or under state law, or to guide or warn traffic. He shall keep a record of all such traffic-control devices. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0201) 
10.20.030 - Crosswalks authorized-Determination criteria. 
    The police chief is authorized, subject to approval of the council by resolution, to designate and maintain crosswalks by appropriate traffic-control devices at intersections where due to traffic conditions there is particular danger to pedestrians crossing the street or roadway, and at such other places as traffic conditions require. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0202) 
10.20.040 - Traffic lanes authorized-Unlawful to cross-Exceptions. 
    The police chief is authorized to mark lanes for traffic on street pavements at such places as traffic conditions require consistent with the traffic code of the city. Where such traffic lanes have been marked, it is unlawful for the operator of any vehicle to fail or refuse to keep such vehicle within the boundaries of any such lane except when lawfully passing another vehicle or preparatory to making a lawful turning movement. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0203) 
Chapter 10.24 - SPEED LIMITS 

10.24.010 - General requirements. 
    Every driver of a motor vehicle on a street shall drive the same at a careful and prudent speed not greater than nor less than is reasonable and proper, having due regard to the traffic, surface and width of the street and of any other conditions then existing, and no person shall drive a vehicle on any street at a speed greater than will permit him to bring it to a stop within the assured clear distance ahead, such driver having the right to assume, however, that all persons using such street will observe the law. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0401) 
10.24.020 - Established-Business districts. 
    A speed in excess of twenty miles per hour in the business district, unless specifically designated otherwise in this chapter, is unlawful. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0402) 
10.24.030 - Established-Residence or school districts. 
    A speed in excess of twenty-five miles per hour in any school or residence district, unless specifically designated otherwise in this article, is unlawful. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0403) 
10.24.040 - Established-Suburban districts. 
    A speed in excess of forty-five miles per hour in any suburban district, unless specifically designated otherwise in this chapter, is unlawful. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0404) 
10.24.050 - Established-Parks, cemeteries and parking lots. 
    A speed in excess of ten miles per hour in those parks designated as North Park and Central Park is unlawful, and a speed in excess of fifteen miles per hour in any public park other than North Park and Central Park and in any cemetery or parking lot, unless specifically designated otherwise in this chapter, is unlawful. 
(Ord. 691 § 1, 1985: prior code § 2.1-2.0405) 
10.24.060 - Driving at slow speeds unlawful-Exception. 
    No person shall drive a motor vehicle at such a slow speed as to impede or block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic, except when reduced speed is necessary for safe operation, or in compliance with law. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0406) 
10.24.070 - Special restrictions-Determination criteria. 
    In accordance with requirements of the State Department of Transportation, or whenever the council shall determine upon the basis of an engineering and traffic investigation that any speed limit hereinbefore set forth is greater or less than is reasonable or safe under the conditions found to exist at any intersection or other place or upon any part of the city street system the council shall determine and adopt by ordinance such higher or lower speed limit as it deems reasonable and safe thereat. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0408) 
10.24.080 - Thirty-mile-per-hour speed zones. 
    A speed in excess of thirty miles per hour shall be unlawful in any of the following designated streets or parts thereof: 
1.  Call Street, from Jones Street to Phillips Street; 
2.  McGregor Street, from west city limits to east city limits; 
3.  Jones Street, from five hundred feet north of Oak Street to State Street; 
4.  State Street, from Jones Street to Phillips Street; 
5.  Diagonal Street, from Phillips Street to Commercial Street; 
6.  Commercial Street, from Roan Street to Main Street; 
7.  Main Street, from Commercial Street to U.S. Highway 18; 
8.  Norwood Drive from Highway 169 to Highway 18; 
9.  Phillips Street from State Street to a point one hundred feet south of the intersection of State Street and Phillips Street. 
(Ord. 958 § 1, 2008; Ord. 847 § 1, 1997; Ord. 640 § 1, 1982; Ord. 639 § 1, 1982; Ord. 609 § 1, 1979; prior code § 2.1-2.0409) 
(Ord. 1002 § 4, 2-13-2014) 
10.24.090 - Thirty-five-mile-per-hour speed zones. 
    A speed in excess of thirty-five miles per hour shall be unlawful on any of the following designated streets or parts thereof. 
1.  Phillips Street, from one hundred feet south of State Street to Irvington Road; 
2.  Finn Drive from Highway 18 to McGregor Street. 
(Ord. 739 § 1, 1989; Ord. 669 § 1, 1983: Ord. 640 § 2, 1982: prior code § 2.1-2.0410) 
10.24.100 - Twenty-five-mile-per-hour speed zones. 
    A speed in excess of twenty-five miles per hour shall be unlawful on any of the following designated streets or parts thereof: 
1.  North Park Drive, from Hall Street to Highway 169. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0411) 
10.24.110 - Forty-mile-per-hour speed zones. 
    A speed in excess of forty miles per hour shall be unlawful on any of the following designated streets or parts thereof: 
1.  U.S. Highway 169 north, from the intersection with U.S. Highway 18 to a point five hundred thirty feet north of said intersection. 
2.  U.S. Highway 169 North, from a point five hundred feet North of Oak Street to the intersection of U.S. Highway 169 with U.S. Highway 18. 
(Ord. 958 § 2, 2008; Ord. 641 § 1, 1982: prior code § 2.1-2.0412) 
(Ord. 1002, § 5, 2-3-2014) 
10.24.120 - Fifty-mile-per-hour speed zones. 
    A speed in excess of fifty miles per hour shall be unlawful on any of the following designated streets or parts thereof: 
1.  Highway 18 West, from a point one thousand fifty feet west of the intersection of U.S. Highway 169 with U.S. Highway 18 to a point four thousand feet west of the same intersection. 
(Ord. 849 § 1, 1997) 
10.24.130 - Fines. 
    The fines for speeding in violation of Chapter 10.24 shall be the same as provided by Algona Municipal Code Section 10.12.285, which incorporates by reference Iowa Code Section 321.285. If no appropriate fine is provided for under Iowa Code Section 321.285, then the fine shall be the standard penalty as set forth in Algona Municipal Code Section 1.12.010. 
(Ord. 1002, § 6, 2-3-2014) 
Chapter 10.28 - STOP AND YIELD INTERSECTIONS AND ONE-WAY STREETS 

10.28.010 - Through streets-stop. 
    Every driver of a vehicle shall stop, unless a yield is permitted by this chapter before entering an intersection with the following designated through streets: 
1.  Phillips Street from Irvington Road to North Street; 
2.  McGregor Street from Lowe Street to McCoy Street; 
3.  State Street from Ackley Street to Minnesota Street; 
4.  Minnesota Street from Fair Street to State Street; 
5.  Diagonal Street from Phillips Street to Roan Street; 
6.  Commercial Street from Main Street to Roan Street; 
7.  Main Street from McGregor Street to State Street, State Street to Commercial Street, and Commercial Street to U.S. Highway No. 18; 
8.  Jones Street from State Street to Oak Street; 
9.  Call Street from Phillips Street to Thorington Street; 
10.  Nebraska Street from Harlan Street to Thorington Street; 
11.  Hall Street from State Street to North Park Drive; 
12.  McCoy Street from Highway 18 to Poplar Street; 
13.  Poplar Street from McCoy Street to Main Street; 
14.  East State Street from Putnam Street to Clarke Street; 
15.  U.S. Highway No. 169 from Oak Street to Norwood Drive; 
16.  U.S. Highway No. 18 from the east city limits to the west city limits; 
17.  Hall Street from MacGregor Street to the south city limits. 
(Ord. 794 § 4, 1993; Ord. 749 §§ 3, 4, 1989; Ord. 687 § 2, 1984; Ord. 605 § 1, 1979; Ord. 582 §§ 1, 2, 1978; prior code § 2.1-2.0601) 
10.28.015 - No stopping signs. 
    The driver of a vehicle shall not stop the vehicle on the street in the following locations: 
1.  Main Street. Vehicles traveling south on Main Street shall not stop on Main Street between North Street and Call Street. 
(Ord. 735 § 4, 1988: prior code § 2.1-2.0610) 
10.28.020 - Special stops required-Intersections designated. 
    Every driver of a vehicle shall stop in accordance with the following: 
1.  Overmeyer Drive. Vehicles traveling south on Thorington Street shall stop at Overmeyer Street; 
2.  Thorington Street. Vehicles traveling west on Overmeyer Drive shall stop at Thorington Street; 
3.  Thorington Street. Vehicles traveling east on Overmeyer Drive shall stop at Thorington Street; 
4.  Maple Street. Vehicles traveling west on Maple Street shall stop at Johnson Street; 
5.  Maple Street. Vehicles traveling east on Maple Street shall stop at Johnson Street; 
6.  Roan Street. Vehicles traveling south on Roan Street shall stop at Lucas Street; 
7.  Roan Street. Vehicles traveling north on Roan Street shall stop at Lucas Street; 
8.  Linden Street. Vehicles traveling east on Linden Street shall stop at Roan Street; 
9.  Linden Street. Vehicles traveling west on Linden Street shall stop at Roan Street; 
10.  Hall Street. Vehicles traveling east on State Street shall stop at Hall Street; 
11.  Phillips Street. Vehicles traveling north on Phillips Street shall stop at Diagonal Street; 
12.  Phillips Street. Vehicles traveling north on Phillips and turning northeast on Diagonal Street shall stop at Diagonal Street; 
13.  Diagonal Street. Vehicles traveling southwest on Diagonal Street shall stop at Phillips Street; 
14.  Vehicles traveling north on Finn Street shall stop at U.S. Highway No. 18; 
15.  Vehicles traveling east on Poplar Street shall stop at Finn Drive; 
16.  Vehicles traveling east on Spruce Street shall stop at Finn Drive; 
17.  Vehicles traveling south on Finn Drive shall stop at McGregor Street; 
18.  Oak Street and Putnam Street. Vehicles traveling west on Oak Street shall stop at Putnam Street; 
19.  Oak Street and Finn Drive. Vehicles traveling east on Oak Street shall stop at Finn Drive; 
20.  Lucas Street. Vehicles traveling west on Lucas Street shall stop at Roan Street; 
21.  Lucas Street. Vehicles traveling east on Lucas Street shall stop at Roan Street; 
22.  Casey Street. Vehicles traveling north on Casey Street shall stop at Poplar Street; 
23.  Oak Street. Vehicles traveling east on Oak Street shall stop at Phillips Street; 
24.  Thorington Street. Vehicles traveling south on Thorington Street shall stop at Overmeyer Drive; 
25.  Fair Street. Vehicles traveling west on Fair Street shall stop at Minnesota Street; 
26.  Fair Street. Vehicles traveling east on Fair Street shall stop at Minnesota Street; 
27.  McCoy Street. Vehicles traveling south on McCoy Street shall stop at Poplar Street; 
28.  Poplar Street. Vehicles traveling west on Poplar Street shall stop at McCoy Street; 
29.  Poplar Street. Vehicles traveling east on Poplar Street shall stop on McCoy Street; 
30.  Reserved; 
31.  Nebraska Street. Vehicles traveling east on Nebraska Street shall stop at Hall Street; 
32.  Nebraska Street. Vehicles traveling west on Nebraska Street shall stop at Hall Street; 
33.  Park Avenue. Vehicles traveling south on Park Avenue shall stop at Oak Street; 
34.  Oak Street. Vehicles traveling east on Oak Street shall stop at the railroad overpass located west of Diagonal Street; 
35.  Oak Street. Vehicles traveling west on Oak Street shall stop at the railroad overpass located west of Diagonal Street; 
36.  State Street. Vehicles traveling east on State Street shall stop at Clarke Street; 
37.  State Street. Vehicles traveling west on State Street shall stop at Clarke Street; 
38.  Clarke Street. Vehicles traveling south on Clarke Street shall stop at State Street; 
39.  State Street. Vehicles traveling east on State Street shall stop at Finn Drive; 
40.  Nebraska Street. Vehicles traveling east on Nebraska Street shall stop at Jones Street; 
41.  Nebraska Street. Vehicles traveling west on Nebraska Street shall stop at Jones Street. 
    The stop signs located at the intersection of Jones Street and Nebraska Street requiring that vehicles traveling north and south on Jones Street stop at Nebraska Street will remain in place until such time as the Algona Chief of Police determines that they should be removed. The stop signs shall be removed prior to the point in time when Jones Street becomes a part of the U.S. Highway 18 detour route designated by the Iowa Department of Transportation. Once the stop signs on Jones Street have been removed, they will not be replaced as the traffic going east and west on Nebraska Street will be required to stop at the Jones Street intersection; 
42.  Parkside Drive. Vehicles traveling south on Parkside Drive shall stop at State Street; 
43.  Valleyview Drive. Vehicles traveling east on Valleyview Drive shall stop at Country Club Road; 
44.  State Street. Vehicles traveling west on State Street shall stop at Finn Drive; 
45.  State Street. Vehicles traveling west on Poplar Street shall stop at Finn Drive. 
46.  Grove Street. Vehicles traveling east on Grove Street shall stop at Hale Street. 
47.  Hale Street. Vehicles traveling south on Hale Street shall stop at Grove Street. 
48.  Hale Street. Vehicles traveling north on Hale Street shall stop at Grove Street. 
(Ord. No. 1018, § 1, 12-21-2015; Ord. 930 §§ 1, 2, 2005; Ord. 885 § 1, 2001; Ord. 863 § 1, 1999; Ord. 861 § 1, 1998; Ord. 811 § 2, 1994; Ord. 794 §§ 5, 6, 1993; Ord. 783 § 1, 1992; Ord. 753 § 1, 1990; Ord. 749 §§ 5, 6, 1989; Ord. 746 § 1, 1989; Ord. 735 § 2, 1988; Ord. 724 § 1, 1987; Ord. 700 § 1, 1985; Ord. 670 § 1, 1983; Ord. 667 § 1, 1983; Ord. 643 § 1, 1982; Ord. 634 § 1, 1981; Ord. 620 § 1, 1980; Ord. 619 § 1, 1980; prior code § 2.1-2.0602) 
10.28.030 - Four-way stop intersections designated. 
    Every driver of a vehicle shall stop before entering the following designated four-way stop intersections: 
1.  Harlan Street and Overmeyer Street. All vehicles approaching the intersection of Jones Street and Overmeyer Street shall stop before entering such intersection; 
2.  Fair Street and Overmeyer Street. All vehicles approaching the intersection of Overmeyer Street and Fair Street shall stop before entering such intersection; 
4.  Johnson Street and Locust Street. All vehicles approaching the intersection of Johnson Street and Locust Street shall stop before entering such intersection; 
5.  Johnson Street and Walnut Street. All vehicles approaching the intersection of Johnson Street and Walnut Street shall stop before entering such intersection; 
6.  Main Street and State Street. All vehicles approaching the intersection of Main Street and State Street shall stop before entering such intersection; 
7.  U.S. Highway No. 169 and U.S. Highway 18. All vehicles approaching the intersection of U.S. Highway No. 169 and U.S. Highway No. 18 shall stop before entering such intersection, except where a yield sign is posted for vehicles turning right at said intersection, in which case every driver of a vehicle shall yield before making a right turn; 
8.  State Street and Finn Drive. All vehicles approaching the intersection of State Street and Finn Drive shall stop before entering such intersection. 
(Ord. 911 § 1, 2003; Ord. 749 § 7, 1989; Ord. 747 § 1, 1989; Ord. 687 § 1, 1984; Ord. 618 § 1, 1980; Ord. 617 § 1, 1980; prior code § 2.1-2.0603) 
10.28.040 - Intersections requiring special yield. 
    Every driver of a vehicle shall yield in accordance with the following: 
1.  Moore Street. Vehicles traveling south on Moore Street shall yield at Overmeyer Drive; 
2.  Dodge Street. Vehicles traveling south on Dodge Street shall yield at Overmeyer Drive; 
3.  Phillips Street. Vehicles traveling north on Phillips Street shall yield at Diagonal Street; 
4.  Main Street. Vehicles traveling south on Main Street shall yield at Commercial Street; 
5.  Oak Ridge Drive. Vehicles traveling south on Oak Ridge Drive shall yield at Thorington Street; 
6.  Lucas Street. Vehicles traveling west on Lucas Street shall yield at Woodworth Street; 
7.  Lucas Street. Vehicles traveling east on Lucas Street shall yield at Woodworth Street; 
8.  Harriet Street. Vehicles traveling south on Harriet Street shall yield at Fair Street; 
9.  Jerome Street. Vehicles traveling south on Jerome Street shall yield at Fair Street; 
10.  Elm Street. Vehicles traveling west on Elm Street shall yield at Phillips Street; 
11.  Elm Street. Vehicles traveling east on Elm Street shall yield at Phillips Street; 
12.  Lucas Street. Vehicles traveling west on Lucas Street shall yield at Phillips Street; 
13.  Lucas Street. Vehicles traveling east on Lucas Street shall yield at Phillips Street; 
14.  Minnesota Street. Vehicles traveling south on Minnesota Street shall yield at Oak Street; 
15.  Minnesota Street. Vehicles traveling north on Minnesota Street shall yield at Oak Street; 
16.  Wooster Street. Vehicles traveling south on Wooster Street shall yield at Oak Street; 
17.  Wooster Street. Vehicles traveling north on Wooster Street shall yield at Oak Street; 
18.  Garfield Street. Vehicles traveling south on Garfield Street shall yield at Oak Street; 
19.  Garfield Street. Vehicles traveling north on Garfield Street shall yield at Oak Street; 
20.  Church Street. Vehicles traveling south on Church Street shall yield at Oak Street; 
21.  Church Street. Vehicles traveling north on Church Street shall yield at Oak Street; 
22.  Lantry Street. Vehicles traveling north on Lantry Street shall yield at Oak Street; 
23.  Woodworth Street. Vehicles traveling south on Woodworth Street shall yield at Oak Street. 
(Ord. 736 § 1, 1988; Ord. 735 § 1, 1988; Ord. 724 § 2, 1987; Ord. 711 § 1, 1986; prior code § 2.1-2.0604) 
10.28.050 - School crossings designated. 
    At the following school crossing zones every driver of a vehicle approaching such zone shall bring his vehicle to a full stop at a point ten feet from the approach side of the crosswalk marked by an authorized school stop sign and thereafter proceed in a careful and prudent manner until he shall have passed through such school crossing zone: 
1.  Jones Street at North Street; 
2.  North Street at Dodge Street; 
3.  Phillips Street at North Street; 
4.  Phillips Street at Lucas Street; 
5.  Main Street at Call Street; 
6.  Main Street at State Street; 
7.  McGregor Street at Jones Street; 
8.  McGregor Street at Harlan Street; 
9.  Kennedy Street at Harriet Street; 
10.  Call Street at a point one hundred feet west of Harlan Street; 
11.  Nebraska Street at Harlan Street; 
12.  Nebraska Street at Jones Street; 
13.  North Street at Church Street; 
14.  Lucas Street at Church Street; 
15.  North Street at McPherson Street; 
16.  North Street at Moore Street; 
17.  McCoy Street at Walnut Street. 
(Ord. 811 § 1, 1994; Ord. 749 § 8, 1989; Ord. 735 § 3, 1988; Ord. 587 § 1, 1978; prior code § 2.1-2.0605) 
10.28.060 - Blocking intersections or crosswalks unlawful. 
    Notwithstanding any traffic-control signal indication to proceed, no driver shall enter an intersection or a marked crosswalk unless there is sufficient space on the other side of the intersection or crosswalk to accommodate the vehicle he is operating. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0607) 
10.28.070 - Traffic-control signals designated. 
    Every driver shall observe and comply with the directions provided by official traffic-control signals at the following intersections: 
1.  Intersection of State Street and Jones Street; 
2.  Intersection of State Street and Harlan Street; 
3.  Intersection of State Street and Moore Street; 
4.  Intersection of State Street and Dodge Street; 
5.  Intersection of State Street and Thorington Street; 
6.  Intersection of Call Street and Jones Street; 
7.  Intersection of Phillips Street and McGregor Street; 
8.  Intersection of Highway 169 North and the access roads to the Algona Shopping Mall to the west and the Hy-Vee/Alco Shopping Center to the east; 
9.  Intersection of State Street and Phillips Street; 
10.  Intersection of North Street and Jones Street. 
(Ord. 747 § 2, 1988; Ord. 685 § 1, 1984; prior code § 2.1-2.0609) 
10.28.080 - One-way streets and alleys designated. 
    Upon the following streets and alleys vehicular traffic, other than permitted cross traffic, shall move only in the indicated direction when appropriate signs are in place. 
1.  State Street, shall be westbound, from Jones Street to Hall Street. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0901) 
10.28.090 - Temporary stop signs. 
    Every driver of a vehicle shall stop whenever temporary stop signs are in place at the following locations: 
1.  Phillips Street at the intersection of Chubb Street. 
2.  McGregor Street at the intersection of Sample Street. 
3.  McGregor Street at the intersection of Hale Street. 
(Ord. No. 965, § 1, 10-18-2010) 
Chapter 10.32 - TURNING MOVEMENTS 

10.32.010 - Authority to mark. 
    The police chief may cause markers, buttons or signs to be placed within or adjacent to intersections and thereby require and direct, as traffic conditions require, that a different course from that specified by the state law be traveled by vehicles turning at intersections, and when markers, buttons or signs are so placed no driver of a vehicle shall turn a vehicle at an intersection other than as directed and required by such markers, buttons or signs. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0501) 
10.32.020 - U-turns. 
    It is unlawful for a driver to make a u-turn at intersections within the business district, at intersections where there are automatic traffic signals, and at the following designated intersections: 
1.  Ridgley Street and State Street. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0502) 
10.32.030 - Left turn for parking. 
    No person shall make a left-hand turn, crossing the centerline of the street, for the purpose of parking on the street. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0503) 
10.32.040 - Left turn on red signal prohibited. 
    Vehicular traffic facing a steady red signal shall not proceed or make a left turn when appropriate signs are in place. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0504) 
Chapter 10.36 - SIZE AND WEIGHT LIMITS 

10.36.010 - Conditions on which limits are permitted. 
    If the council declares an embargo when it appears by reason of deterioration, rain, snow or other climatic conditions that certain streets will be seriously damaged or destroyed by vehicles weighing in excess of an amount specified by the signs, no such vehicles shall be operated on streets so designated by such signs. 
(Prior code 2.1-2.0701) 
10.36.020 - Special permit issuance procedures. 
    The police chief may, upon application in writing and good cause being shown therefor, issue a special permit in writing authorizing the applicant to operate or move a vehicle or combination of vehicles of a size or weight or load exceeding the maximum specified by state law or city ordinance over those streets named in the permit which are under the jurisdiction of the city and for which the city is responsible for maintenance. 
(Prior code 2.1-2.0702) 
10.36.030 - Vehicle load limits-Streets designated. 
    When signs are erected giving notice thereof, no person shall operate any vehicle with a gross weight in excess of the amounts specified on such signs at any time upon any of the following streets or parts of streets: 
    None. 
(Prior code 2.1-2.0703) 
10.36.040 - Bridge load limits-Signposting. 
    Where it has been determined that any city bridge has a capacity less than the maximum permitted on the streets of the city, or on the street serving the bridge, the police chief may cause to be posted and maintained signs on said bridge and at suitable distances ahead of the entrances thereof to warn drivers of such maximum load limits, and no person shall drive a vehicle weighing, loaded or unloaded, upon such bridge in excess of such posted limit. 
(Prior code 2.1-2.0704) 
Chapter 10.40 - PEDESTRIANS 

10.40.010 - Use of sidewalks required. 
    Where sidewalks are provided it is unlawful for any pedestrian to walk along and upon an adjacent street. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.0801) 
Chapter 10.44 - PARKING 

10.44.010 - Adjacent to curbs-Method. 
    No person shall stand or park a vehicle in a street other than parallel with the edge of the roadway headed in the direction of lawful traffic movement and with the right-hand wheels of the vehicle within eighteen inches of the curb or edge of the roadway except as hereinafter provided in the case of angle parking and vehicles parked on the left-hand side of one-way streets. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.1001) 
10.44.020 - Adjacent to curbs-One-way streets. 
    No person shall stand or park a vehicle on the left-hand side of a one-way street other than parallel with the edge of the roadway headed in the direction of lawful traffic movement and with the left-hand wheels of the vehicle within eighteen inches of the curb or edge of the roadway except as hereinafter provided in the case of angle parking. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.1002) 
10.44.030 - Diagonal parking-Streets designated. 
    Angle or diagonal parking shall be permitted only in the following locations: 
1.  State Street, on the south side, from Jones Street to Williams Street; 
2.  State Street, on the north side, from Jones Street to Williams Street; 
3.  Call Street, on the north side, from Jones Street to Hall Street; 
4.  Call Street, on the south side, from Jones Street to Hall Street; 
5.  Nebraska Street, on the north side, from Jones Street to Hall Street; 
6.  Nebraska Street, on the south side, from Thorington Street to Harlan Street; 
7.  Harlan Street, on the east side, from McGregor Street to Nebraska Street; 
8.  Thorington Street, on the west side, from Call Street to State Street; 
9.  Harlan Street, on the west side from Call to State Street; 
10.  Call Street, on the south side, starting from the back of the curb on the west side of Minnesota Street, then proceeding west on Call Street for a distance of one hundred ten feet; 
11.  Call Street, on the south side, from Minnesota Street to Wooster Street; 
12.  Harlan Street, on the west side, from State Street proceeding south to the alley located between State Street and Nebraska Street; 
13.  Moore Street, on the west side, from McGregor Street to State Street; 
14.  Moore Street, on the east side, from State Street proceeding north to the alley located between State Street and Call Street, however, no diagonal parking shall be permitted in front of the garage located south of the alley on that portion of Moore Street. 
15.  Moore Street, on the west side, from Call Street proceeding south to the alley located between Call Street and State Street; 
16.  Dodge Street, on the east side, starting from the back of the curb on the east side of Nebraska Street, then proceeding south on Dodge Street for a distance of one hundred fifteen feet; 
17.  Dodge Street, on the west side, starting from the back of the curb on the west side of Nebraska Street, then proceeding south on Dodge Street for a distance of fifty-five feet; 
18.  Dodge Street, on the east side, from Nebraska Street to State Street; 
19.  Dodge Street, on the west side, from Call Street proceeding south to the alley located between Call Street and State Street. 
(Ord. No. 1012, § 1, 2-2-2015; Ord. 943 §§ 1, 2, 2007; Ord. 912 § 1, 2003; Ord. 681 § 1, 1984; prior code § 2.1-2.1003) 
10.44.040 - Angle parking-Method. 
    Upon those streets or portions of streets which have been signed or marked for angle parking, no person shall park or stand a vehicle other than at an angle to the curb or edge of the roadway or in the center of the roadway as indicated by such signs and markings. No part of any vehicle, or the load thereon, when parked within a diagonal parking district, shall extend into the roadway more than a distance of sixteen feet when measured at right angles to the adjacent curb or edge of roadway. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.1004) 
10.44.050 - Unlawful acts designated. 
    No person shall park a vehicle upon the roadway for any of the following principal purposes: 
1.  Displaying such vehicle for sale; 
2.  For commercial washing, greasing or repairing such vehicle except such repairs as are necessitated by an emergency; 
3.  Displaying advertising; 
4.  Selling merchandise from such vehicle except in a duly established market place or when so authorized or licensed under the city code; 
5.  Storage or as junkage or dead storage for more than forty-eight hours. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.1005) 
10.44.060 - Stopping, standing or parking-Interfering with public ways. 
    No one shall stop, stand or park a vehicle except when necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic or in compliance with the directions of a peace officer or traffic-control device, in any of the following places: 
1.  Crosswalk. On a crosswalk at an intersection; 
2.  Center Parkway. On the center parkway or dividing area of any divided street; 
3.  Mailboxes. Within twenty feet on either side of a mailbox which is so placed and so equipped as to permit the depositing of mail from vehicles on the roadway; 
4.  Sidewalks. On or across a sidewalk; 
5.  Driveway. In front of a public or private driveway; 
6.  Intersection. Within, or within ten feet of an intersection of any street or alley; 
7.  Fire Hydrant. Within five feet of a fire hydrant; 
8.  Stop Sign or Signal. Within ten feet upon the approach to any flashing beacon, stop or yield sign, or traffic-control signal located at the side of a roadway; 
9.  Railroad Crossing. Within fifty feet of the nearest rail of a railroad crossing, except when parked parallel with such rail and not exhibiting a red light; 
10.  Fire Station. Within twenty feet of the driveway entrance to any fire station and on the side of a street opposite the entrance to any fire station within seventy-five feet of the entrance when properly sign posted; 
11.  Excavations. Alongside or opposite any street excavation or obstruction when such stopping, standing or parking would obstruct traffic; 
12.  Double Parking. On the roadway side of any vehicle stopped or parked at the edge or curb of a street; 
13.  Hazardous Locations. When, because of restricted visibility or when standing or parked vehicles would constitute a hazard to moving traffic, or when other traffic conditions require, the chief of police may cause curbings to be painted with a yellow color and erect no parking or standing signs; 
14.  Theatres, Hotels and Auditoriums. A space of fifty feet is reserved at the side of the street in front of any theatre, auditorium, hotel having more than twenty-five sleeping rooms, hospital, nursing home, taxicab stand, bus depot, church or other building where large assemblages of people are being held, within which space, when clearly marked as such, no motor vehicle shall be left standing, parked or stopped except in taking on or discharging passengers or freight, and then only for such length of time as is necessary for such purpose; 
15.  Controlled Access Facility Approach. On the minor street approach for a distance of thirty-five feet in advance of the stop sign or on the exit side of the minor street for a distance of thirty-five feet beyond the crosswalk of any controlled access facility intersection; 
16.  Public Alley. In any public alley, except to load or unload, and then not in excess of thirty minutes; 
17.  Private Alley. In any private alley in such a manner that ingress or egress of fire apparatus to or from such alley might be blocked. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.1006) 
10.44.070 - Stopping, standing or parking prohibited-Streets designated. 
    No one shall stop, stand or park a vehicle in any of the following specifically designated no parking zones except when necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic or in compliance with the direction of a peace officer or traffic-control signal: 
1.  McGregor Street from Hall Street to the west corporate limits; 
2.  McGregor Street from Minnesota Street to the east corporate limits; 
3.  State Street, from Jones Street to Phillips Street; 
4.  Call Street, from Jones Street to Phillips Street; 
5.  Jones Street, from State Street to Oak Street; 
6.  Elm Street, on the north side, from Woodworth Street to Putnam Street; 
7.  Main Street, from Commercial Street to U.S. Highway No. 18; 
8.  Diagonal Street from North Street to Roan Street; 
9.  Commercial Street from Roan Street to Main Street; 
10.  Thorington Street, on the east side, from Call Street to Hall Street; 
11.  Hall Street, from Call Street to the railroad tracks; 
12.  North Park Drive, from the railroad tracks to U.S. Highway No. 169; 
13.  Phillips Street, on the west side, from North Street to Pine Street; 
14.  Lucas Street, on the south side, from Phillips Street to Garfield Street; 
15.  McPherson Street, on the west side, from McGregor Street to the dead end; 
16.  Wooster Street, on the east side, from McGregor Street to Kennedy Street; 
17.  Minnesota Street from McGregor Street south to the city limits; 
18.  Jones Street, on the east side, from McGregor Street to Overmeyer Drive; 
19.  Harlan Street, on the west side, from McGregor Street to Nebraska Street; 
20.  Harlan Street, on the east side, from McGregor Street to Overmeyer Drive; 
21.  Dodge Street, on the east side, from McGregor Street to Overmeyer Drive; 
22.  Thorington Street, on the east side, from McGregor Street to Overmeyer Drive; 
23.  Nebraska Street, on the south side, from West Street to Hall Street; 
24.  Hall Street, on the west side, from McGregor Street to a point one-half block north of Nebraska Street; 
25.  Elm Street, on the south side, from Jones Street to Thorington Street; 
26.  Colby Street, on the west side, from the alley one hundred thirty-two feet south of State Street to McGregor Street; 
27.  Wooster Street, on the east side, from McGregor Street to State Street; 
28.  South Hale Street, on the west side, from McGregor Street to Orchard Street; 
29.  South Sample Street, on the east side, from McGregor Street to Chubb Street and South Sample Street, on the west side from Grove Street to Chubb Street; 
30.  North Woodworth Street, on the west side, from Oak Street to Commercial Street; 
31.  Commercial Street on the north side from Diagonal Street to North Woodworth Street; 
32.  Norwood Drive on the north side and the west side from Highway 169 to Highway 18; 
33.  Swetting Street on the south side from North Thorington Street to North Hall Street; 
34.  Overmeyer Drive on the north side from Blackford Street to Smith Street and Overmeyer Drive on the south side, one hundred sixty-four feet west from the intersection of the west right-of-way of Smith Street and the south right-of-way of Overmeyer Drive; 
35.  Hall Street from Overmeyer Drive south to the city limits; 
36.  Harlan Street, on the east side, between Call Street and North Street; 
37.  Thorington Street, on the west side, from the extended south line of Oak Street to the extended north line of Oak Street; 
38.  Oak Street, on the south side, for a distance of three hundred feet from the intersection of Oak Street and Thorington Street; 
39.  South Hall Street, on the west side from McGregor Street to River View Drive; and South Hall Street, on the east side from McGregor Street to Kennedy Street; 
40.  The west side of Minnesota Street from State Street to one-half block south of State Street; 
41.  The south side of Kennedy Street from Hall Street to Wooster Street; 
42.  Both sides of Main Street for a distance of thirty-five feet south from the intersection of Main Street with the south right-of-way line of U.S. Highway 18; 
43.  Both sides of Norwood Drive for a distance of thirty-five feet south from the intersection of Norwood Drive with the south right-of-way line of U.S. Highway 18; 
44.  Both sides of McCoy Street for a distance of thirty-five feet south from the intersection of McCoy Street with the south right-of-way line of U.S. Highway 18; 
45.  Both sides of Finn Drive for a distance of thirty-five feet south from the intersection of Finn Drive with the south right-of-way line of U.S. Highway 18; 
46.  Both sides of Plum Creek Road for a distance of thirty-five feet northeasterly from the intersection of Plum Creek Road with the north right-of-way line of U.S. Highway 18; 
47.  Church Street, on the west side, for a distance of fifty-five feet north from the intersection of Church Street and Lucas Street; 
48.  The east side of Church Street from Lucas Street to Elm Street; 
49.  Between the curb and the sidewalk on both sides of State Street from Phillips Street to Jones Street; 
50.  Between the curb and the sidewalk on both sides of Jones Street from State Street to Oak Street; 
51.  Both sides of Maple Place for a distance of thirty-five feet east from the stop sign at the intersection of Maple Place and U.S. Highway No. 169; 
52.  Both sides of Oak Street for a distance of thirty-five feet west from the stop sign located on the west side of the intersection of Oak Street and Jones Street; 
53.  Both sides of Oak Street for a distance of one hundred forty-five feet east from the stop sign located on the east side of the intersection of Oak Street and Jones Street; 
54.  Both sides of Elm Street for a distance of thirty-five feet west from the stop sign located on the west side of the intersection of Elm Street and Jones Street; 
55.  Both sides of Elm Street for a distance of thirty-five feet east from the stop sign located on the east side of the intersection of Elm Street and Jones Street; 
56.  Both sides of Lucas Street for a distance of thirty-five feet west from the stop sign located on the west side of the intersection of Lucas Street and Jones Street; 
57.  Both sides of Lucas Street for a distance of thirty-five feet east from the stop sign located on the east side of the intersection of Lucas Street and Jones Street; 
58.  Both sides of North Street for a distance of thirty-five feet west from the west side of the back of the curb of Jones Street as extended straight across North Street; 
59.  Both sides of North Street for a distance of thirty-five feet east from the east side of the back of the curb of Jones Street as extended straight across North Street; 
60.  Both sides of Call Street for a distance of thirty-five feet west from the west side of the back of the curb of Jones Street as extended straight across Call Street; 
61.  Both sides of Jones Street for a distance of thirty-five feet south from the south side of the back of the curb of State Street as extended straight across Jones Street; 
62.  Both sides of Minnesota Street for a distance of thirty-five feet north from the stop sign located on the north side of the intersection of Minnesota Street and State Street; 
63.  Both sides of Minnesota Street for a distance of thirty-five feet south from the stop sign located on the south side of the intersection of Minnesota Street and State Street; 
64.  Both sides of Wooster Street for a distance of thirty-five feet north from the stop sign located on the north side of the intersection of Wooster Street and State Street; 
65.  Both sides of Wooster Street for a distance of thirty-five feet south from the stop sign located on the south side of the intersection of Wooster Street and State Street; 
66.  Both sides of Colby Street for a distance of thirty-five feet north from the stop sign located on the north side of the intersection of Colby Street and State Street; 
67.  Both sides of Colby Street for a distance of thirty-five feet south from the stop sign located on the south side of the intersection of Colby Street and State Street; 
68.  Both sides of McPherson Street for a distance of thirty-five feet north from the stop sign located on the north side of the intersection of McPherson Street and State Street; 
69.  Both sides of McPherson Street for a distance of thirty-five feet south from the stop sign located on the south side of the intersection of McPherson Street and State Street; 
70.  Both sides of State Street for a distance of thirty-five feet east from the east side of the back of the curb of Phillips Street as extended straight across State Street; 
71.  Phillips Street, from North Street to the south city limits; 
72.  U.S. Highway No. 169, from Oak Street to the north city limits; 
73.  U.S. Highway No. 18, from the east city limits to the west city limits; 
74.  North Street, beginning at a point one hundred feet west of the northwest corner of Phillips Street and North Street, then extending west for a distance of two hundred feet. This two-hundred-foot no parking zone shall only apply between the hours of eight a.m. and four p.m. on Monday through Friday inclusive, on days when school is in session; 
75.  Both sides of McGregor Street from Phillips Street to the West city limits until such time when McGregor Street is no longer a part of the U.S. Highway 18 detour route designated by the Iowa Department of Transportation, at which time this paragraph shall become null and void; 
76.  Jones Street from McGregor Street to Nebraska Street until such time as that one block is no longer a part of the U.S. Highway 18 detour route designated by the Iowa Department of Transportation, at which time this paragraph shall become null and void; 
77.  The south and west side of Overmeyer Drive from Dodge Street to Hall Street; 
78.  The north side of that portion of Minnesota Street that runs east and west for a distance of one hundred twenty feet east from the east side of the back of the curb of Minnesota Street that runs north and south; 
79.  The south side of Grove Street from Sample Street to Hale Street. This no parking zone shall be in existence only between the hours of eight a.m. and four p.m. on Monday through Friday, inclusive, on days when school is in session; 
80.  The West side of McCoy Street from Poplar Street to Maple Street. This no parking zone shall be in existence only between the hours of eight a.m. and four p.m. on Monday through Friday, inclusive, on days when school is in session; 
81.  The south side of Locust Street from Johnson Street to McCoy Street; 
82.  The south side of Walnut Street from Johnson Street to McCoy Street; 
83.  The south side of Fair Street from Minnesota Street to Phillips Street; 
84.  The south side of North Street for a distance of one hundred sixty-five feet east from the east side of the back of the curb of Jones Street as extended straight across North Street; 
85.  The north side of Maple Street from Johnson Street to McCoy Street; 
86.  The north side of Overmeyer Drive from Thorington Street to Hall Street, except parking shall be allowed from a point beginning thirty-five feet east of the stop sign located on the north side of the intersection of Overmeyer Drive and Hall Street and continuing east on Overmeyer Drive a distance of one hundred sixty-eight feet; 
87.  The north side of North Street for a distance of ninety feet west from the west side of the back of the curb of Phillips Street as extended straight across North Street; 
88.  The south side of North Street for a distance of one hundred fifty feet west from the west side of the back of the curb of Phillips Street as extended straight across North Street; 
89.  The west side of McPherson Street between North Street and Call Street; 
90.  The east side of Moore Street for a distance of two hundred eighty feet north from the north side of the back of the curb of Overmeyer Drive as extended straight across Moore Street; 
91.  The north side of Chubb Street between Jerome Street and Minnesota Street; 
92.  The north side of Lucas Street between Dodge Street and Harlan Street. 
93.  Moore Street, on the east side, from McGregor Street to Overmeyer Drive. 
(Ord. 950 §§ 1-3, 2007; Ord. 931 § 1, 2005; Ord. 920 § 1, 2004; Ord. 909 § 1, 2003; Ord. 896 § 1, 2002: Ord. 883 § 1, 2001; Ord. 865 § 1, 1999; Ord. 846 § 1, 1997; Ord. 837 § 1, 1996; Ord. 812 § 1, 1994; Ord. 808 § 1, 1994; Ord. 794 § 3, 1993; Ord. 761 § 1, 1990; Ord. 749 §§ 1, 2, 1989; Ord. 736 § 2, 1988; Ord. 676 § 1, 1984; Ord. 675 § 1, 1984: Ord. 673 § 1, 1984; Ord. 665 § 1, 1983; Ord. 658 § 1, 1983; Ord. 651 § 1, 1982; Ord. 650 § 1, 1982; Ord. 610 § 1, 1980; Ord. 608 § 1, 1979; Ord. 607 § 1, 1979; Ord. 606 § 1, 1979; Ord. 588 §§ 1, 2, 1978; prior code § 2.1-2.1007) 
(Ord. No. 967, § 1, 4-4-2011; Ord. No. 981, § 1, 4-2-2012; Ord. 999, § 1, 10-21-2013) 
10.44.080 - Limited parking. 
    It is unlawful for any person, firm, corporation or association or any agent or employee thereof to park or leave standing any vehicle, motor driven or otherwise within the designated parking spaces on the north side of Call Street from Thorington Street to Dodge Street, the south side of Call Street from Thorington Street to the west line of the north-south alley in Block 20, Original Plat of the city of Algona, Iowa, both sides of State Street from Jones Street to Hall Street, both sides of Harlan Street lying between the south line of the east-west alley in Blocks 22 and 23, Original Plat of the city of Algona and the north line of the east-west alley lying north of Blocks 27 and 28, Original Plat of the city of Algona, Iowa, both sides of Dodge Street from Call Street to Nebraska Street, both sides of Thorington Street from Call Street to the north line of the east-west alley running through Blocks 29 and 30, Original Plat of the city of Algona, Iowa, both sides of Hall Street from Call Street to State Street for a period in excess of two hours between the hours of nine a.m. and five p.m. on Monday through Saturday inclusive excluding therefrom holidays. 
(Ord. 616 §§ 2, 3, 1980: prior code § 2.1-2.1014) 
10.44.090 - All night parking prohibited-Streets designated. 
    No person, except physicians or other persons on emergency calls, shall park a vehicle on any of the following named streets for a period of time longer than thirty minutes between the hours of two a.m. and six a.m. of any day: 
1.  State Street from Jones Street to Thorington Street; 
2.  Thorington Street from Call Street to Nebraska Street; 
3.  Dodge Street from Call Street to Nebraska Street; 
4.  Moore Street from Call Street to Nebraska Street; 
5.  Harlan Street from Call Street to Nebraska Street; 
6.  McGregor Street from Hall Street to Minnesota Street. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.1008) 
10.44.100 - Truck parking limited-Streets designated. 
    No person shall park a motor truck, semitrailer or other motor vehicle with trailer attached in violation of the following regulations. The provisions of this section shall not apply to pick up, light delivery or panel delivery trucks: 
1.  Residence District. Excepting only when such vehicles are actually engaged in the delivery or receiving of merchandise or cargo within the prohibited area, no person shall park or leave unattended such vehicle, on any of the streets in areas of the city which are zoned for residential use only. When actually receiving or delivering merchandise or cargo such vehicle shall be stopped or parked in a manner which will not interfere with other traffic; 
2.  Nebraska Street. No such vehicle shall be parked or left unattended on Nebraska Street from Minnesota Street to Jones Street. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.1009) 
10.44.110 - Handicapped parking regulations. 
    Parking for the use of the physically handicapped is provided as follows: 
A.  Designated Spaces. No one shall stop, stand or park a vehicle in any of the following specifically designated handicapped parking places unless the vehicle displays a special handicapped identification device issued in accordance with state law: 
1.  The second, third, fourth, fifth and sixth perpendicular parking spaces south of Nebraska Street on the east side of Smith Street; 
2.  Reserved; 
3.  The first parking space west of Moore Street on the north side of State Street; 
4.  The first parking space east of Harlan Street on the north side of State Street; 
5.  The first parking space west of Moore Street on the south side of State Street; 
6.  The first parking space west of Dodge Street on the south side of State Street; 
7.  The first parking space north of State Street on the east side of Dodge Street; 
8.  The first parking space north of State Street on the east side of Thorington Street; 
9.  The first parking space from the west and the fourth parking space from the east, both in the second row from the north, located in the municipal parking lot located northeast of the intersection of Nebraska Street and Thorington Street; 
10.  The first parking space west of Thorington Street on the north side of Call Street; 
11.  The twelfth parking space west of Thorington Street on the north side of Call Street; 
12.  The first parking space south of Call Street in the first north-south row west of Moore Street located in the municipal parking lot located southwest of the intersection of Moore Street and Call Street; 
13.  The eighth, ninth, tenth and eleventh parking spaces west of Harlan Street on the north side of Nebraska Street; 
14.  The first parking space north of the sidewalk to the shelter house in Veterans Park and the first parking space south of the sidewalk to the shelter house in Veterans Park; 
15.  The first parking space on the northwest corner of the building on the north side of the Algona Public Library; 
16.  The first parking space on the south side of the southeast corner of the shop for the street department; 
17.  The seventh parking space from the south end of the parking area in front of the eightplex on the east side of Williams Street between State Street and Call Street; 
18.  A parking space on the east side of Moore Street located one hundred thirty feet south of McGregor Street; 
19.  The eighth parking space and ninth parking space north of McGregor Street on the east side of Harlan Street; 
20.  The eighteenth parking space west of South Phillips Street on the north side of Kennedy Street; 
21.  A parking space forty-four feet south of the sidewalk going east into the Bertha Godrey Elementary School on the east side of Main Street; 
22.  The first parking space southwest of the southwest drive into Casey's Convenience Store on Diagonal Street; 
23.  Two parking spaces in front of Trinity Lutheran Church on the east side of Garfield Street between Elm Street and Lucas Street; 
24.  The first forty-five feet north of North Street on the east side of Dodge Street; 
25.  A parking space one hundred fifty feet south of McGregor Street on the east side of Moore Street; 
26.  The first parking space south of the alley on the west side of Dodge Street, between State Street and Nebraska Street; 
27.  Four parking spaces located on the north side of State Street, beginning sixty-one feet eight inches west of the west right-of-way line of Woodworth Street and continuing west on the north side of State Street to a point one hundred thirteen feet eight inches west of the west right-of-way line of Woodworth Street; 
28.  The first parking space west of Moore Street on the north side of Call Street; 
29.  The first, second and third parking spaces on the south side of Call Street located west of the alley that is between Hall Street and Williams Street; 
30.  Reserved; 
31.  Reserved; 
32.  Reserved; 
33.  The seventh parking space west of Harlan Street on the north side of Call Street on Saturdays and Sundays only; 
34.  Reserved; 
35.  Reserved; 
36.  The first parking space east of Thorington Street on the south side of State Street; 
37.  Two parking spaces located one hundred seventy feet south of McGregor Street extending south on the east side of Moore Street; 
38.  Reserved; 
39.  The first parking space east of Hall Street on the north side of State Street; 
40.  The first parking space east of Moore Street on the north side of State Street; 
41.  The first parking space east of Moore Street on the south side of State Street; 
42.  The first parking space east of Dodge Street on the south side of State Street; 
43.  The first parking space west of the alley on the north side of State Street, between Dodge Street and Thorington Street; 
44.  The first parking space west of Jones Street on the north side of State Street; 
45.  The sixth parking space west of Jones Street on the south side of State Street; 
46.  All designated handicapped parking spaces in all municipal parking lots within the city of Algona, Iowa; 
47.  The first parking space east of Harlan Street on the north side of Nebraska Street. 
B.  Unlawful Use. The use of parking spaces, which are designated for the handicapped and which are located on public property, by a motor vehicle not displaying a special handicapped identification device issued in accordance with state law, or by a motor vehicle displaying such a device but not being used as operator or passenger by the individual to whom the device has been issued or another individual physically handicapped to the extent described by Chapter 321L, Code of Iowa, is unlawful and shall be a misdemeanor. 
(Ord. 948 § 1, 2007; Ord. 927 §§ 1-5, 2005; Ord. 882 § 1, 2001; Ord. 876 § 1, 2000; Ord. 840 § 1, 1997; Ord. 835 § 1, 1996; Ord. 818 § 2, 1995; Ord. 804 § 1, 1994; Ord. 803 § 2, 1994; Ord. 794 §§ 1, 2, 1993; Ord. 792 § 1, 1993; Ord. 788 § 1, 1992; Ord. 775 §§ 1, 2, 1991; Ord. 765 § 1, 1991; Ord. 762 §§ 1, 2, 1990; Ord. 707 § 1, 1986; Ord. 704 § 1, 1986; prior code § 2.1-2.1010) 
(Ord. No. 980, § 1, 4-2-2012; Ord. No. 986, § 1, 8-6-2012; Ord. 995, § 1, 8-19-2013) 
10.44.120 - Municipal parking lots-Time restrictions. 
    It is unlawful for any person, firm, corporation or association or any agent or employee thereof, to park or leave standing any vehicle, motor driven or otherwise, within the parking lots owned or leased by the city, at any time for a period of time in excess of twenty-four continuous hours. A police officer is authorized to remove, or cause to be removed, such vehicle parked or left standing in such municipal lot for a period of time in excess of twenty-four continuous hours provided a diligent effort shall first be made to locate the owner and if found he shall be given an opportunity to remove the vehicle. In addition to the standard penalties provided, the owner of such impounded vehicle shall be required to pay the reasonable cost of towing and storage. 
(Ord. 595 § 1, 1979: prior code § 2.1-2.1012 (part)) 
10.44.130 - Parks and recreational areas. 
    No person shall park a vehicle within a city park except in those areas as may be designated from time to time by the parks commission of the city. Such areas designated by the parks commission as appropriate for parking a vehicle shall be so indicated by the placing of appropriate parking signs. 
(Ord. 656 § 1, 1983: prior code § 2.1-2.1012 (part)) 
10.44.140 - Vehicle length restrictions-Streets designated. 
    It is unlawful for any person, firm, corporation or association or any agent or employee thereof to park or leave standing any vehicle, motor driven or otherwise, other than motor vehicles no longer than fourteen feet in length, within the designated parking spaces set forth below: 
1.  A space twelve feet wide located on the west side of South Harlan Street in the first diagonal parking space located immediately north of the alley running east and west through Block 27 of the Original Plat of the city; 
2.  A space twelve feet wide located on the east side of South Dodge Street located in the first diagonal parking space south of the alley running east and west through Block 28 of the Original Plat of the city; 
3.  A space twelve feet wide located on the west side of North Dodge Street in the first diagonal parking space located north of the alley that runs east and west through Block 20, Original Plat of the city; 
4.  A space twelve feet wide located on the west side of North Moore Street located in the first diagonal parking space immediately north of the alley running east and west through Block 21 of the Original Plat of the city; 
5.  A space twelve feet wide located on the east side of North Moore Street in the first parking space located immediately south of the alley that runs east and west through Block 22 of the Original Plat of the city; 
6.  A space twelve feet wide located on the south side of Call Street in the first diagonal parking space located immediately west of the intersection of Harlan Street and Call Street in the city; 
7.  The first parking space on the south side of Call Street, east of the intersection with Thorington Street; 
8.  The first parking space on the south side of Call Street, west of the intersection with Thorington Street; 
9.  The first parking space on the north side of Call Street, east of the intersection with Thorington Street; 
10.  The first parking space on the west side of Hall Street, south of the intersection with Call Street; 
11.  The first parking space on the south side of Call Street, east of the intersection with Harlan Street; 
12.  The first parking space on the north side of Call Street, east of the intersection with Harlan Street; 
13.  The first parking space on the north side of Call Street, west of the intersection with Harlan Street; 
14.  The first parking space on the north side of Call Street, west of the intersection with Moore Street; 
15.  The first parking space on the south side of Call Street, east of the intersection with Dodge Street; 
16.  The first parking space on the south side of Call Street, west of the intersection with Dodge Street; 
17.  The first parking space on the north side of Call Street, west of the intersection with Dodge Street; 
18.  The first parking space on the south side of Call Street, east of the intersection with Minnesota Street. 
(Ord. 765 § 2, 1991; Ord. 710 § 1, 1986: prior code § 2.1-2.1015) 
10.44.150 - Parking during times when a snow emergency has been declared-Impoundment and other penalties authorized. 
    Except for physicians on emergency calls or drivers of emergency vehicles, it is unlawful for any person to park, abandon or leave unoccupied or unattended any vehicle on a public street if a snow emergency has been declared by the city street superintendent, the director of public works, the chief of police or a designee of any of the foregoing offices. The declaration of a snow emergency shall be provided by means of a public service announcement on the local radio station covering the city. Once a snow emergency has been declared, then all vehicles must be removed from any public street once the time of the snow emergency goes into effect. The vehicles must be removed even if no snow has fallen. The snow emergency shall remain in effect until snow removal has been completed or the snow emergency is terminated by announcement of the city. The snow emergency may be extended if additional declarations are made by the city as previously set forth in this section. 
    A violation of this section is a scheduled violation and subject to a fine of twenty-five dollars. Admitted violations may be charged upon a simple notice of a fine of twenty-five dollars payable at the office of the city clerk. If such fine is not paid within three business days, a complaint may be filed as provided by the code of Iowa. The scheduled fine shall be increased by five dollars if it is not paid within thirty days of the date upon which the violation occurred. 
    In the event any vehicle is in violation of this section, any police officer of the city is authorized to remove or cause to be removed or to tow or to have towed or otherwise remove such vehicle to such place as the chief of police may from time to time direct. In addition to the standard penalty provided in Chapter 1.12 of this municipal code, the owner of such impounded vehicle shall be required to pay the reasonable cost of towing and storage. It is unlawful for any person to reclaim the vehicle so removed and stored without first paying the reasonable cost of towing and storage. 
    The police department shall have complete discretion as to whether a scheduled violation is issued to a vehicle in violation of this section or if the vehicle is towed. 
(Ord. 934 § 2, 2006) 
10.44.160 - Signposting required for restricted areas. 
    Whenever by this chapter or any other section of the municipal code any parking time limit is imposed or parking is prohibited on designated streets or portions of streets it shall be the duty of the police chief to erect or cause to be erected appropriate signs giving notice thereof and no such regulations shall be effective unless signs are erected and in place at the time of any alleged offense. When the signs are so erected giving notice thereof, no person shall disobey the restrictions stated on such signs. 
(Prior code § 2.1-2.1011) 
10.44.170 - Loading/unloading parking-Areas designated. 
    Parking for loading and unloading only shall be provided for in the following designated areas: 
1.  The paved area of parking located within the street right-of-way on the south side of Overmeyer Drive located west of Thorington Street and north of the bathhouse at the Algona Aquatic Center. Vehicles using this parking area for loading or unloading shall not be parked there for longer than five minutes. The area designated for loading and unloading shall be allowed even though the rest of the south side of Overmeyer Drive is a no parking zone. 
2.  The seventh perpendicular parking space south of Nebraska Street on the east side of Smith Street, which space is located west of the entrance to Maple Park Apartments. Vehicles using this parking area for loading or unloading shall not be parked there for longer than 15 minutes. 
(Ord. 887 § 1, 2001; Ord. 883 § 2, 2001; Ord. 867 § 1, 1999) 
(Ord. No. 986, § 2, 8-6-2012) 
Chapter 10.48 - CONTROLLED ACCESS FACILITIES 

10.48.010 - Purpose and intent. 
    This chapter shall be deemed an exercise of the police power of the city under Chapter 306A, Code of Iowa, 1975, for the preservation of the public peace, health, safety and for the promotion of the general welfare. 
(Prior code § 8-1.0201) 
10.48.020 - Controlled access facility defined. 
    The term "controlled access facility" means a highway or street especially designed for through traffic, and over, from or to which owners or occupants of abutting land or other persons have no right or easement or only a controlled right of easement of access, light, air or view by reason of the fact that their property abuts upon such controlled-access facility or for any other reason. 
(Prior code § 8-1.0202) 
10.48.030 - Right of access limited. 
    No person shall have any right of ingress or egress to, from or across any controlled access facility except at such points as may be permitted by the Iowa Highway Commission and designated by ordinance. 
(Prior code § 8-1.0203) 
10.48.040 - Access controls imposed on U.S. No. 18 and U.S. No. 169. 
    There are fixed and established controlled access facilities on the primary road system extension improvement, Project Nos. U 111(6) and F 140(5) Primary Road Nos. 18 and 169 within the city described as follows: 
A.  Phillips Street. Phillips Street from the south corporate limit to the south line of Call Street; 
B.  Center Street. The south half of Center Street from the east corporate limit to the west corporate limits. regulating access to and from abutting properties along said highway all in accordance with the plans for such improvement identified as Project No. U 111(6) and Project No. F 140(5) on file in the office of the clerk. 
(Prior code § 8-1.0204) 
10.48.050 - Permitted access points designated. 
    Points of access for U.S. Nos. 18 and 169 are permitted as follows:

(Ord. 814 §§ 1, 2, 1994; prior code § 8-1.0205) 
Chapter 10.52 - ABANDONED VEHICLES 

10.52.010 - Definitions. 
    For use in this chapter the following terms are defined: 
A.  "Abandoned vehicle" means any of the following: 
1.  A vehicle that has been left unattended on public property for more than forty-eight hours and lacks current registration plates or two or more wheels or other parts which renders the vehicle inoperable; or 
2.  A vehicle that has remained illegally on public property for more than seventy-two hours; or 
3.  A vehicle that has been unlawfully parked on private property or has been placed on private property without the consent of the owner or person in control of the property for more than twenty-four hours; or 
4.  A vehicle that has been legally impounded by order of the police department and has not been reclaimed for a period of ten days; or 
5.  Any vehicle parked upon a street determined by the police department to create a hazard or obstruction to other vehicle traffic. 
If the owner or operator of a vehicle is unable to move the vehicle, notifies the police department of his problem and requests assistance in the removal of the vehicle, then a vehicle shall not be considered abandoned for a period of fifteen days from the date the police were notified. 
B.  "Department" means the police department of the city of Algona, Iowa. 
C.  "Private property" means any real property within the city which is not public property as defined in this section. 
D.  "Public roperty" means any public right-of-way open for the purposes of vehicular travel. 
E.  "Vehicle" means every device in, upon, or by which a person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a highway or street, excepting devices moved by human power or used exclusively upon stationary rails or tracks, and shall include without limitation a motor vehicle, automobile, truck, trailer, motorcycle, tractor, buggy, wagon, farm machinery or any combination thereof. 
(Added during 1988 codification) 
10.52.020 - Impoundment-Authority. 
    The department may, without prior notice or hearing, remove and impound any abandoned vehicle on public property and any abandoned vehicle on private property. The department may employ city personnel, equipment and facilities or hire other personnel, equipment and facilities for the purpose of removing, preserving, storing or disposing abandoned vehicles. Nothing in this chapter shall govern the procedures of any police officer in taking into custody and impounding any vehicle to be used or proposed to be used as evidence in a criminal case involving crimes other than violations of this chapter. 
(Added during 1988 codification) 
10.52.030 - Impoundment-Notification of owners and lienholders. 
A.  When a vehicle is taken into custody under the provisions of this chapter or under any provisions of state law, the department shall notify, within twenty days, by certified mail, the last known registered owner of the vehicle, all lienholders of record, and any other known claimant to the vehicle or to personal property found in the vehicle, addressed to their last known addresses of record, that the abandoned vehicle has been taken into custody. Notice shall be deemed given when mailed. The notice shall describe the year, make, model and serial number of the vehicle, describe the personal property found in the vehicle, set forth the location of the facility where the vehicle is being held, and inform the persons receiving the notice of their right to reclaim the vehicle and personal property within twenty-one days after the effective date of the notice upon payment of all towing, preservation and storage charges resulting from placing the vehicle in custody and upon payment of the costs of notice required pursuant to this section. The notice shall also state that the failure of the owner or lienholders to exercise their right to reclaim the vehicle within the time provided shall be deemed a waiver by the owner and all lienholders of all right, title, claim and interest in the vehicle and that failure to reclaim the vehicle is deemed consent to the sale of the vehicle at a public auction or disposal of the vehicle to a demolisher. The notice shall state that any person claiming rightful possession of the vehicle or personal property who disputes the planned disposition of the vehicle or property by the department or of the assessment of fees and charges provided by this section may ask for a hearing before the city administrator to contest those matters. The notice shall also state that a request for a hearing must be in writing and received by the department prior to the expiration of the twenty-one-day reclaiming period. In addition, the notice shall state that in the event a hearing is requested, immediate release of the vehicle may be obtained by posting a cash bond in an amount equal to the sum of the impoundment fee, towing charges, preservation charges, storage charges and notice charges. If the persons receiving the notice do not ask for a hearing or do not exercise their right to reclaim the vehicle within the twenty-one-day reclaiming period, the owner and lienholders shall no longer have any right, title, claim or interest in or to the vehicle. No court in any case in law or equity shall recognize any right, title, claim or interest of the owner and lienholders after the expiration of the twenty-one-day reclaiming period. 
B.  If the identity of the last registered owner cannot be determined, or if the registration contains no address for the owner, or if it is impossible to determine with reasonable certainty the identity and addresses of all lienholders, notice by one publication in one newspaper of general circulation in the area where the vehicle was abandoned shall be sufficient to meet all requirements of notice under this section. The published notice may contain multiple listings of abandoned vehicles but shall be published within the same time requirements and contain the same information as prescribed for mailed notice in this section. 
C.  The owner or any lienholders may, by written request delivered to the department prior to the expiration of the twenty-one-day reclaiming period, obtain an additional fourteen days within which the vehicle may be reclaimed. 
(Added during 1988 codification) 
10.52.040 - Impoundment-Fees. 
    Before the owner or other person lawfully entitled to possession of any vehicle that has been impounded under the provisions of this chapter or any other provision of law may recover such vehicle, such person shall present to the department evidence of such person's identity and right to possession of the vehicle, shall sign a receipt for its return, and shall pay the costs of: 
A.  An impoundment fee of ten dollars if claimed within five days of impounding, plus one dollar for each additional day within the reclaiming period; and 
B.  Towing charges; and 
C.  Preservation charges; and 
D.  Storage charges; and 
E.  Notice charges. 
(Added during 1988 codification) 
10.52.050 - Impoundment-Hearing. 
A.  The registered owner or any lienholder of record may object to the legality of the impoundment or the assessment of fees and request a hearing thereon. Request for a hearing after an impoundment shall be made in writing and received by the department prior to the expiration of the twenty-one-day reclaiming period. No person shall be entitled to more than one hearing on each impoundment. After requesting a hearing, the objector shall be informed of the reason for the impoundment and a hearing shall be held, without unnecessary delay, before a hearing officer who shall be the city administrator. Upon request of the objector, the hearing may be set for a later time and date, however, the new date shall be no later than twenty days after the original hearing date. 
B.  At the hearing, the hearing officer shall consider the objection, make a decision as to the legality of the impoundment and immediately notify the objector in writing of the decision. The decision shall state either of the following: 
1.  That impoundment is authorized by law, an explanation for the basis of that decision, and an itemization of the charges assessed pursuant to this chapter. Any bond posted shall be applied to the satisfaction of the charges itemized by the hearing officer; 
2.  That impoundment is not authorized by law, and if the vehicle has been impounded, that the vehicle will be released to the objector upon the objector presenting to the department evidence of such person's identity and right to possession of the vehicle, and after the objector signs a receipt for its return. All costs of removal, preservation, storage and notification accruing through the fourth day after the hearing officer's decision are waived and will be paid by the city. All costs accruing thereafter shall be paid prior to recovery of the vehicle. Any bond posted shall be refunded.
